href="https://crrev.com/2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742"><!---->2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742<!----></a> (HEAD, origin/master, origin/HEAD)<span class="line"><!----> (HEAD, origin/master, origin/HEAD)<!----></span><br>Author: Wenyu Zhao <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Wenyu Zhao &lt;<!----></span>wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:wenyu.zhao@anu.edu"><!---->wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<!----></a>.au><span class="line"><!---->.au&gt;<!----></span><br>Date:   Wed Apr 21 10:32:15 2021 +1000<span class="line"><!---->Date:   Wed Apr 21 10:32:15 2021 +1000<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>POC.js is as follow:<span class="line"><!---->POC.js is as follow:<!----></span><br>/**************************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/**************************************************/<!----></span><br>function main() {<span class="line"><!---->function main() {<!----></span><br>const v0 = [];<span class="line"><!---->const v0 = [];<!----></span><br>let v1 = v0;<span class="line"><!---->let v1 = Looking at the history, we get repeated reports about this, and in many cases it should be possible to turn those crashes into exceptions.<!----></span><br>It's not high priority, but it would improve the user experience if we could fix those crashes one by one.<span class="line"><!---->It's not high priority, but it would improve the user experience if we could fix those crashes one by one.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

kMaxLength check to use new_capacity instead of index<!----></span><br><br>This partially reverts <span class="line"><!---->This partially reverts <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3905062<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3905062"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3905062<!----></a><br>and moves the kMaxLength check to be based on `new_capacity` instead of<span class="line"><!---->and moves the kMaxLength check to be based on `new_capacity` instead of<!----></span><br>`index`.<span class="line"><!---->`index`.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1201626<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201626" title="Fatal JavaScript invalid size error"><!---->BUG=chromium:1201626<!----></a><br><br>Change-Id: Ief8481018a64b7b0d853e95bd74e1fbb47282b6a<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ief8481018a64b7b0d853e95bd74e1fbb47282b6a<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4701223<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4701223"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4701223<!----></a><br>Commit-Queue: Shezan Baig <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Shezan Baig &lt;<!----></span>sbaig1@bloomberg.net<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/sbaig1@bloomberg.net"><!---->sbaig1@bloomberg.net<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Reviewed-by: Victor Gomes <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Victor Gomes &lt;<!----></span>victorgomes@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/victorgomes@chromium.org"><!---->victorgomes@chromium.org<!----></a>><span         by

        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

          z-index: 999;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;

        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;

          width: 100%;

      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <mr-edit-description id="edit-description"></mr-edit-description>
        <mr-move-copy-issue id="move-copy-issue"></mr-move-copy-issue>
        <mr-convert-issue id="convert-issue"></mr-convert-issue>
        <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>

    <!----></mr-issue-page>
        <!----></main>
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>
    <!----></mr-app>


        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

    background: none;

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

          </optgroup>
        </select>
      </div>

          <i class="material-icons">search</i>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<span class="line"><!---->Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit         Turning into a normal bug in case you want to track changing the error message<span class="line"><!---->Turning into a normal bug in case you want to track changing the error message<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<span class="line"><!---->Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742"><!---->2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742<!----></a> (HEAD, origin/master, origin/HEAD)<span class="line"><!----> (HEAD, origin/master, origin/HEAD)<!----></span><br>Author: Wenyu Zhao <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Wenyu Zhao &lt;<!----></span>wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:wenyu.zhao@anu.edu"><!---->wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<!----></a>.au><span class="line"><!---->.au&gt;<!----></span><br>Date:   Wed Apr 21 10:32:15 2021 +1000<span class="line"><!---->Date:   Wed Apr 21 10:32:15 2021 +1000<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>POC.js is as follow:<span class="line"><!---->POC.js is as follow:<!----></span><br>/**************************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/**************************************************/<!----></span><br>function main() {<span class="line"><!---->function main() {<!----></span><br>const v0 = [];<span class="line"><!---->const v0 = [];<!----></span><br>let v1 = v0;<span class="line"><!---->let v1 = v0;<!----></span><br>v1.length = 4294967295.0;<span class="line"><!---->v1.length = 4294967295.0;<!----></span><br><br>function v5() {<span class="line"><!---->function v5() {<!----></span><br>    v1.length = 0;<span class="line"><!---->    v1.length = 0;<!----></span><br>    const v7 = v1.fill();<span class="line"><!---->    const v7 = v1.fill();<!----></span><br>    //return 2147483648.0;<span class="line"><!---->    //return 2147483648.0;<!----></span><br>    //return 0xffffffff;<span class="line"><!---->    //return 0xffffffff;<!----></span><br>    return -1<span v10 = v1.fill(1.1,0,v9);<span class="line"><!---->const v10 = v1.fill(1.1,0,v9);<!----></span><br><br><br>return v1<span class="line"><!---->return v1<!----></span><br><br><br>print(v1[0])<span class="line"><!---->print(v1[0])<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>%NeverOptimizeFunction(main);<span class="line"><!---->%NeverOptimizeFunction(main);<!----></span><br>main();<span class="line"><!---->main();<!----></span><br><br>/****************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/****************************************/<!----></span><br><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../src/heap/factory-base.cc, line 131<span         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

kMaxLength check to use new_capacity instead of index<!----></span><br><br>This partially reverts <span class="line"><!---->This partially reverts <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3905062<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3905062"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/3905062<!----></a><br>and moves the kMaxLength check to be based on `new_capacity` instead of<span class="line"><!---->and moves the kMaxLength check to be based on `new_capacity` instead of<!----></span><br>`index`.<span class="line"><!---->`index`.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=chromium:1201626<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1201626" title="Fatal JavaScript invalid size error"><!---->BUG=chromium:1201626<!----></a><br><br>Change-Id: Ief8481018a64b7b0d853e95bd74e1fbb47282b6a<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ief8481018a64b7b0d853e95bd74e1fbb47282b6a<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4701223<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4701223"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4701223<!----></a><br>Commit-Queue: Shezan Baig <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Shezan Baig &lt;<!----></span>sbaig1@bloomberg.net<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/sbaig1@bloomberg.net"><!---->sbaig1@bloomberg.net<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Reviewed-by: Victor Gomes <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Victor Gomes &lt;<!----></span>victorgomes@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/victorgomes@chromium.org"><!---->victorgomes@chromium.org<!----></a>><span         by

        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

          z-index: 999;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">

          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<span class="line"><!---->Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit origin/master, origin/HEAD)<!----></span><br>Author: Wenyu Zhao <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Wenyu Zhao &lt;<!----></span>wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<a class="undefined" target="_blank" follow:<!----></span><br>/**************************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/**************************************************/<!----></span><br>function main() {<span class="line"><!---->function main() {<!----></span><br>const v0 = [];<span class="line"><!---->const v0 = [];<!----></span><br>let v1 = v0;<span class="line"><!---->let v1 =           Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<span class="line"><!---->Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742"><!---->2cd77745d92044e77ec6b91cbf04d9132b639742<!----></a> (HEAD, origin/master, origin/HEAD)<span class="line"><!----> (HEAD, origin/master, origin/HEAD)<!----></span><br>Author: Wenyu Zhao <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Wenyu Zhao &lt;<!----></span>wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:wenyu.zhao@anu.edu"><!---->wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<!----></a>.au><span class="line"><!---->.au&gt;<!----></span><br>Date:   Wed Apr 21 10:32:15 2021 +1000<span class="line"><!---->Date:   Wed Apr 21 10:32:15 2021 +1000<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>POC.js is as follow:<span class="line"><!---->POC.js is as follow:<!----></span><br>/**************************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/**************************************************/<!----></span><br>function main() {<span class="line"><!---->function main() {<!----></span><br>const v0 = [];<span class="line"><!---->const v0 = [];<!----></span><br>let v1 = v0;<span class="line"><!---->let v1 = v0;<!----></span><br>v1.length = 4294967295.0;<span class="line"><!---->v1.length = 4294967295.0;<!----></span><br><br>function v5() {<span class="line"><!---->function v5() {<!----></span><br>    v1.length = 0;<span class="line"><!---->    v1.length = 0;<!----></span><br>    const v7 = v1.fill();<span class="line"><!---->    const v7 = v1.fill();<!----></span><br>    //return 2147483648.0;<span class="line"><!---->    //return 2147483648.0;<!----></span><br>    //return 0xffffffff;<span class="line"><!---->    //return 0xffffffff;<!----></span><br>    return -1<span class="line"><!---->    return -1<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>const v9 = {valueOf:v5};<span class="line"><!---->const v9 = {valueOf:v5};<!----></span><br><br>const v10 = v1.fill(1.1,0,v9);<span class="line"><!---->const v10 = v1.fill(1.1,0,v9);<!----></span><br><br><br>return v1<span class="line"><!---->return v1<!----></span><br><br><br>print(v1[0])<span class="line"><!---->print(v1[0])<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>%NeverOptimizeFunction(main);<span class="line"><!---->%NeverOptimizeFunction(main);<!----></span><br>main();<span class="line"><!---->main();<!----></span><br><br>/****************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/****************************************/<!----></span><br><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../src/heap/factory-base.cc, line 131<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../src/heap/factory-base.cc, line 131<!----></span><br># Fatal JavaScript invalid size error 77731507<span class="line"><!----># Fatal JavaScript invalid size error 77731507<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#FailureMessage Object: 0x7ffeefbfdc10<span class="line"><!---->#FailureMessage Object: 0x7ffeefbfdc10<!----></span><br>==== C stack trace ===============================<span class="line"><!---->==== C stack trace                                0x000000010008bf13 v8::base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() + 19<!----></span><br>    1   d8                                  0x0000000100093bfb StoreInArrayLiteralIC<span class="line"><!---->[ic] Propagate array error in StoreInArrayLiteralIC<!----></span><br><br>Instead of throwing a fatal error when setting a value in an array with<span class="line"><!---->Instead of throwing a fatal error when setting a value in an array with<!----></span><br>index larger than FixedArray:kMaxLength, we now throw an exception.<span class="line"><!---->index larger than FixedArray:kMaxLength, we now throw an exception.<!----></span><br><br>This CL propagates the exception in StoreInArrayLiteralIC.<span class="line"><!---->This CL propagates the exception in StoreInArrayLiteralIC.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: chromium:1235093<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1235093" title="Fatal error in           Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org

      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org

        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 50<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      mat.r...@icloud.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mat.r...@icloud.com<!----></span>

    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 22, 2023, 7:03 AM EST (22 hours ago)"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 22, 2023, 7:03 AM EST (22 hours ago)"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
    <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>

      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
