      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<span class="line"><!---->Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit follow:<!----></span><br>/**************************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/**************************************************/<!----></span><br>function main() {<span         ishell@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ishell@chromium.org"><!---->ishell@chromium.org<!----></a> Can it be made public, or is it embargoed?<span class="line"><!----> Can it be made public, or is it embargoed?<!----></span><br><br>Otherwise we do not have a way to track the status and progress, while Chrome is crashing for our website visitors (our app is more complicated than the the minimal repro, but gives exactly the same error).<span class="line"><!---->Otherwise we do not have a way to track the status and progress, while Chrome is crashing for our website visitors (our app is more complicated than the the minimal repro, but gives exactly the same error).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 50<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      mat.r...@icloud.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mat.r...@icloud.com<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 22, 2023, 7:03 AM EST (22 hours ago)"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 22, 2023, 7:03 AM EST (22 hours ago)"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<span class="line"><!---->Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit origin/master, origin/HEAD)<!----></span><br>Author: Wenyu Zhao <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Wenyu Zhao &lt;<!----></span>wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<a class="undefined" target="_blank" follow:<!----></span><br>/**************************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/**************************************************/<!----></span><br>function main() {<span class="line"><!---->function main() {<!----></span><br>const v0 = [];<span class="line"><!---->const v0 = [];<!----></span><br>let v1 = v0;<span class="line"><!---->let v1 =           Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 50<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c50">Comment 50<!----></a>

          
        by

        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        </div>

      -------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<span class="line"><!---->Hello，I think I got a crash about v8 security.It seems that we can control length and even the content of array when filling a array.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit origin/master, origin/HEAD)<!----></span><br>Author: Wenyu Zhao <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Wenyu Zhao &lt;<!----></span>wenyu.zhao@anu.edu<a class="undefined" target="_blank" follow:<!----></span><br>/**************************************************/<span class="line"><!---->/**************************************************/<!----></span><br>function main() {<span         I stumbled upon this while doing some WebGPU development. I'm not sure if the original repro case on this bug still works (I couldn't easily get it to work) so here's a page which reproduces it, in case it is helpful:<span class="line"><!---->I stumbled upon this while doing some WebGPU development. I'm not sure if the original repro case on this bug still works (I couldn't easily get it to work) so here's a page which reproduces it, in case it is requires WebGPU, so you'll need Chrome 113+ on Win/Mac (Beta/Canary right now), or the chrome flag --enable-unsafe-webgpu.<span class="line"><!---->This requires WebGPU, so you'll need Chrome 113+ on         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1201626#c47">Comment 47<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 20, 2023, 3:19 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          tebbi@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<span class="line"><!---->As Igor says this is a hard limitation on the elements backing store sizes.<!----></span><br><br>We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<span class="line"><!---->We had an attempt on making these crashes into exceptions. That was easy on Ignition, but much more complicated in the optimizing compilers.<!----></span><br>The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<span class="line"><!---->The reason is that this can make *many* TF node throwable/stateful, exploding the number of sea of nodes, since every throwable node creates a diamond shape graph, additionally their success/fail continuations need to be linked in a complicated way. This creates complexity and slow down TF for all compilations (even those that do not care about this issue).<!----></span><br><br>Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<span class="line"><!---->Adding @tebbi who had an attempt on this with me in the past.<!----></span><br><br>Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<span class="line"><!---->Since throwing an exception is not really necessary according to the ECMAScript standard. My plan is to reverse the Ignition work, so that all the tiers agree with the outcome.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<span class="line"><!---->This crash message will also show up if you run `let a = []; while(true) a.push(1)`. Javascript engines are supposed to throw an error on invalid length but node seems to abort the process instead. This is a bug not a security issue.<!----></span><br>Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<span class="line"><!---->Throwing an error will allow the programmer to much more easily determine the cause of the bug, and allow them to potentially catch it<!----></span><br>To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<span class="line"><!---->To be fair it's quite surprising a bug like this has made it all the way to Node 20<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

          <tbody>

            </div>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
